abstract: The British oil company exceeded analysts’ forecasts by 15 percent, and plans to continue asset sales and dispensing money to shareholders.
snippet: The British oil company exceeded analysts’ forecasts by 15 percent, and plans to continue asset sales and dispensing money to shareholders.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British oil company BP said on Tuesday that its profit for the third quarter, adjusted for one-time items, was $3.7 billion. That was down 26 percent from the period a year earlier, but exceeded analysts’ forecast.

headline.main: BP Increases Its Dividend as Earnings Beat Forecasts
headline.print_headline: BP Increases Its Dividend As Earnings Beat Forecasts

byline.original: By Stanley Reed and Clifford Krauss
